Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and ideal for a long weekend break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Slgil
Reviews.Content: Just got back after staying at the Rose Garden Palace Hotel for 3 nights. The hotel was great and spotless. Our room was very spacious with a lovely bathroom and we were told we would have a king sized bed but actually it was bigger than a king size! The breakfast was your typical continental breakfast but you could get scrambled egg, bacon and sausages. The only downfall would be the location as it is not in the centre of Rome (there are taxi's outside) but if you don't mind a fifteen minute walk I would definitely recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mediocre breakfast, iffy housekeeping...”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaRyanOrange
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week's stay at the Rose Garden Palace in Rome. The location was great for me if just a bit far from Rome's central area. But being off the beaten path was a plus as the neighborhood is very safe and residential. In fact, there is a police station around the corner and the American Embassy is across the street. (Rooms facing the street are a bit noisier due to the metal pylons that go up and down with a bang for each vehicle that enters.) I wasn't bothered, however, since the sound spelled safety to me. There are also lots of good, inexpensive restaurants within a few blocks walk. I especially liked San Marco--not gourmet, but predictable, and always open. On the negative side, although the room was spacious (we received an upgrade), the furniture was a bit worn. Again, not a problem as we all have nicks and scratches as we get older. The one thing that was annoying was the unevenness of the housekeeping--half glasses of water left after cleaning, a dirty wash cloth left in the tub--no replacement of soap. In fact, there never was enough soap. Sometimes there was a nightly turndown--other times not. Also, the breakfast was very disappointing. By the third day I longed for something good and hot and different. The rolls were stale five days out of seven, the eggs and bacon uneatable, and the assortment of sweets never changing. On the plus side the breakfast room was pretty with an outside garden that will soon be in blossom with roses and the staff was courteous. I would give the hotel three and one half "circles" if allowed mainly for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with gracious staff”
Reviews.Author: Margaret F
Reviews.Content: Lovely stay here, a terrific location. We conducted a seminar here and every detail was attended to with great care. I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: anns1933
Reviews.Content: Just off the Via Veneto this boutique hotel across from the American Embassy offers inviting rooms, a lovely bar, fitness center, and small indoor pool (a rarity in downtown Rome!), and easy access to public transportation and taxi lines. Within 15 minutes walk of the Spanish Steps, 10 minutes walk to Villa Borghese, 20 minutes walk to Paizza Republica, 5 minutes walk to Piazza Barberini, you are within striking distance of most attractions. You are very close to Casino Ludovisi on Via Lombardia, which is a most worthwhile visit. The Reservations Manager, Carmen, is a joy, and most interested in helping you find a room appropriate to your needs. A lovely breakfast is served in the "rose garden" a glass-enclosed atrium. THere is a full menu for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Perillo Tours THE BEST!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tonytartufo
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to take some time and thank Perillo Tours for a wonderfull experience. My wife and I took an 11 day Aristocrat tour in June and we could not have been happier. Rome, Florence and Venice were absolutely amazing! The food was top notch and our tour guides were more than acomodating considering we do not speak a word of Italian! lololol. Our last few days in Rome we stayed at the Rose Garden Palace. My wife and I felt like movie stars! Location is incredible and they boutique style hotel is right up our alley. Would I recommend a Perillo tour?? Absolutely yes! Antonio Rodrigues Chappaqua, NY

Reviews.Title: “Perillo Tour”
Reviews.Author: Linda T
Reviews.Content: tour was wonderful and the tour guide, Nello was amazing. The food was phenomenal, the hotels were centrally located and were beautiful, the other tour members were friendly and I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: kat88nyc
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel....perfect location...very clean and modern.....we were very comfortable. The only thing that could use help was the breakfast. We will definately stay there again when we go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “BEST IN ROME”
Reviews.Author: kellyleman
Reviews.Content: This is not your typical European hotel, this hotel is real chic-romantic jewel!!! Our room was Fabulous, big comfortable bad, great view from our room out looking the side of the American embassy and the city, big walk-in closet with a mirror, also, I find it strange to give bath rooms a complement but this bath room was done with the finest décor, even the shower had was the raining type if you know what I mean… perfectly white and daily changed bathrobes… every little detail seem to be accounted for us to feel absolutely pampered :) We are almost sure that the room was cleaned more than once a day! The breakfast was tasty, but not to get excited about. The hotel is in the finest living area in all of Rome, and you should know that there is great bus transportation just outside the hotel. Just don't forget to buy tickets before you get on the bus like I did, oops :) Too bad that the hotel pool was closed for the whole time we stayed there… If you have any questions I'd be happy to answer through facebook.com I AM DEFENETLY COMING BACK AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for a Rome City Break”
Reviews.Author: stevebrigden
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three days at the Rose Garden Palace between Christmas and New Year 2011. The hotel was perfect. It is in an excellent location which allows easy walking to any of the main attractions in Rome. The hotel was in very good repair, with excellent room amenities - for example, a small walk-in wardrobe in our standard room. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, preferring to go out into Rome for that, but the bar was very comfortable and served alcohol :-) All of the staff we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful - reception desk and bar. The only negative from our perspective, was that the beds were very firm which aren't to our liking - so our sleeps weren't the best. But that's really personal preference, so doesn't count against the hotel! Totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: SallyB2
Reviews.Content: This very good hotel has a wonderful location off the Via Veneto. It is perfect for business or a city break. I have used it for both. The rooms are excellent - the standard rooms are jus as good as the superior ones. Very good bathrooms. Everything is clean and well cared for. Breakfast downstairs is nice. The staff are very nice and helpful as regards making reservations and also things like late departures. This is my hotel of preference in Rome. There are also superb restaurants in the area. I have stayed here about 10 times now and never had a problem. This is a very good 4-star hotel and beats most 5-star (and more expensive) Rome hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel - great bedrooms for Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Redbaytraveller
Reviews.Content: Its our second visit - and while we looked at other hoterls its hard to beat the Rose Garden Palace - its a haven of peace after a busy day shopping and sightseeing - and great to come into the open plan bar and flop into a soft sofa for a glass of Prosecco! On the plus side - the bedrooms are really new and large by Rome standards - bright and airy, chic decor, tall ceilings and spotlessly clean - on the downside - its about a 15min walk to the Spanish Steps - but we just hopped in a taxi. On the last nighe we ate in the hotel and the food was delicious - I'm a bit dubious about hotel menus but this was a great surprise and with only 6 of us in the dining room - we had the chef to ourselves - scrumptious food - and well priced wine - well done Rose Garden Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust111Chicago
Reviews.Content: Expected more from this hotel based on a recommendation as well as Trip Advisor reviews. Agree that the hotel is in an excellent location, less than a block away from Via Vento and short walking distance to the Spanish Steps. However, the staff seemed indifferent and at some points just rude (to the point of rolling eyes) when we asked about various tours in the area or suggestions for dinner. This may be avoided if the hotel were to invest in a conceirge to handle requests. The room was holiday inn-ish at best with outdated bathrooms as well as furnishings. We stayed in a triple room and for 475Euro per night, didn't think it was worth it. Finally, we tended to have alot of bugs flying around the room and not sure where they were coming from, kept us up for most of the night, every night. On a positive note, the breakfast is lovely and the morning wait staff delightful. We also had drinks in the bar in the evening and again the wait staff was very accomodating and pleasant. If you do decide to stay at this hotel, would recommend that you request a room that does not face the US Embassy, we had to listen to the motor gate open and close day and night and it is quite loud.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet and in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Michele S
Reviews.Content: The Rose Garden Palace is a lovely hotel in a great location just off the Via del Tritone which is a long main artery of the city. The hotel is modern, was comfortable, quiet, very clean and very well furnished. The staff was very friendly and efficient. I ordered breakfast from room service and it was great. I did not have an opportunity to eat in the restaurant II Roseto but I hear the food is excellent. The hotel was right off Via Veneto and Via del Tritone which are main arteries of the city, about a 15-min walk from Trevi Fountain and The Spanish Steps, as well as Villa Borghese which is a stunning park. It's not very close to the Vatican City -- you'll want to take a taxi there from the hotel. Or even better, ride the hop-on-hop-off open bus (cost 13-euros roundtrip without getting off the bus) which is only 5-blocks away from the Rose Garden (across the street from the Eden Hotel) and takes you to see all these sites and many more! The Rose Garden is perfect and enough of the beaten path to be away from the crowds, traffic, noise and hustle and bustle of the city. Small lobby/lounge/bar area but more relaxing that the fancier hotels. My room was lovely with high ceilings and was toward the back of the hotel overlooking the courtyard and the outdoor part of the II Roseta restaurant. I expected noise from diners but it was very quiet. The hotel is only about 5-stories tall so it has a cozy feel to it. I would stay there again the next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: sherman3
Reviews.Content: The Rose Garden Place is a good hotel in a great location. simple with no frills. this is a good hotel if your looking for a good place to stay but dont need any of the amentities of the larger hotel chains, for example, knowledgable concierge etc....the lobby is small, bar is small. we didnt eat at the restaurant but there are many options close by.... we had a junior suite which was nice and offered a bit more space.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: weddinggirlsf
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly staff, good buffet breakfast, large rooms, comfortable bed Cons: Could use a good scrubing down, bathroom a bit dirty, we called the lobby for towels and never got them, location is ok, unless you can walk all over a taxi might be needed when the feet get tired.

Reviews.Title: “Rose Garden Palace”
Reviews.Author: thunderbird0609
Reviews.Content: Very decent hotel. Rooms are nice, but nothing special. Good staff and very nice breakfast. Ended up being a very good location in a very nice section of town taht is a bit more quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: peters97
Reviews.Content: The hotel is directly across the street from the American Embassy. It's a beautiful part of Rome close to shopping, restaurants, even a mini market to pick up essentials. The staff was courteous and reinstated my faith in Rome since the horrible experience two years ago at the Mecinate palace.

Reviews.Title: “One for the oldies”
Reviews.Author: Fussy01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - nice and quiet and out of the way from all the touristy places. The service was very good, however there were some language issues when ordering room service. The rooms were nice but a bit old fahsioned looking, there was no wifi access in our room which was really frustrating. If you are a retired American tourist who does not feel the need for internet access, likes old fashioned decor, old fashioned service (including things like a telephone next to the toilet) and wants words like 'Amercian style' before everything on the menu- then this is the place for you. If you are not American - you may feel a bit like you are intruding on their holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Quiet Perfect Oasis”
Reviews.Author: GoneAgain02
Reviews.Content: Thanks TripAdvisor reviewers for helping us find this clean, friendly, quiet, safe (across the street from the American Embassy) hotel. We stayed five nights, and especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet being open until 10:00! Price was upper mid-range, but worth it. Walk to Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Ten Euro cab ride to Vatican. Staff was very helpful. Our room wasn't ready so they offered coffee or water with a snack while we waited 45 minutes! Hospitality plus. Slow internet access in lobby our only complaint. Would go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: deserttraveler30
Reviews.Content: Great hotel....nice rooms Helpful staff Would enjoy a large bar/lounge area separate from the front office area...like a separate room

Reviews.Title: “Would love to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Helen B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights, we were greeted by a bottle of champagne in out room . Loved it, would love to go back again. From the minuite we stepped inside we recieved great service. All the staff were friendly and helpful and spoke good English putting me to shame with my terrible attempts at Italian. We stayed in room 503 which has great views, our room and the Hotel was always very clean. Breakfast was very pleasant with an option to sit outside, the staff happy to get anything that wasn't on show at the buffet. We asked at reception for places they recomended for dinner, always happy to help when asked. Infact we asked reception a lot of questions about various places and always with great English they helped us. We found the Hotel location fantastic, we got a taxi to the Vatican museum and another day to The Colosseum, not that either couldn't be walked and indeed we walked back from both. It was only 7 euro to either and it suited us with the heat and early pre-booked tours to get taxi's. About a 30 min easy walk to either of these with much to take in on the way. The Spanish steps are literally just down the road, about 5-6min walk with many lovely restaurants and cafes(Caffe Leonardo), another 5 minuites on again to the Trevi Fountain. We found so much in fact all of what we had time to see within walking distance. The Hotel has a small whirlpool pool in the basement, so nice to get in and unwind after a long hot day sightseeing, really sweet for couples (not a family pool), i could see many dangers for kids in it, ledges etc. It is set out like a Roman Bath with a big ledge half way down all round the pool, the whirlpool jets are quite strong for kids i would think. Great to sit in and chat and chill out though, we loved it and never saw anyone else in it, like having our own private pool! I can't find anything at all to complain about with this Hotel and have travelled a lot, can't wait to go back one day. Fantastic holiday, fantastic Hotel, fantastic staff.

Reviews.Title: “Rated a 4start +.... Not quite”
Reviews.Author: Tim0te0
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to this stay prior to moving on to Sorrento and it was our 3rd 4star hotel on this trip. Located across form the American embassy, and only a 15 minute walk from the Spanish steps, the staff was pleasant as to be expected but if your english only speaking, a challange. Not much more then get you in the hotel and get you out. A 20% off coupon for their restraunt helped curve the cost of eatting in that evening. Prices were a bit more steep then expected (about 22 euro per plate average) and a bottle of water at 7 euro. Restraunt staff was excellent!!! Only thing that kept the 4s flowing No conceirge to speak of and limited advice from desk on where to get best deals, dinner outside hotel or when to visit somewhere local. The room: 304 facing main street. Our room was about average, bed was nothing much to speak of and while they adverstise SKY satelite TV, if it worked we got FOX News or BBC International. But whos in rome to watch TV.... The bath was the best part of the room. Tiled floor to ceiling, it just said "come relax". Loved the tub! Plenty of bath bubbles for the long soak after a tour. WiFi - Free and laptop pulled it up anywhere in the room. Picked up electrical adapter free from desk for 3 prong plug. Bed turned down in evening - A nice touch we didnt ask for but was not real comfortable NOT knowing they would be by. Use the safe at all times as always when on trips as we had clothing out, not expecting anyone to come in but our valuables were locked up. Mini-Bar Again - The dreaded mini-bar was charged to our room for a beer and vodka. Happened on the night that our bed was turned down so we are putting 2 + 2 together. We kept our do not disturb up after that. Front desk was NOT very undestanding and wanted us to pay for it regardless. We stood our ground and the cost was removed. Pool - was nice, suana was never operational during stay. Fitness room was above average with nice showers and changing room. Morning breakfast - Very nice! Well worth the time to relax before going out. Only complaint was the extremly runny eggs. Overall a nice stay, being sold to us as a 4star plus, I would say I was disappointed after where we have stayed in 4 star hotels. Would not choose this one again as there were several up the street with nicer appeance for about same cost as this.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, convenient and very nice”
Reviews.Author: albatros63
Reviews.Content: Very quite, clean street, lot of American tourists... Very comfortable and convenient to Borghese house. Great breakfast and service, nice staff . We thoroughly enjoyed it...

Reviews.Title: “Positively Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: kelley m
Reviews.Content: I am Kelley, from the United States. My daughter just got married on August 6, 2011 at the Rose Garden Palace, in Rome, Italy. The Rose Garden is located directly across from the U.S. Embassy. Words cannot describe the beauty of the area. I can't believe that planning a wedding in another country could have been so seemless. Marina, the event coordinator is a true professional. We communicated for months, via email & telephone. I never waited for a response from her. Everything she does is done with such detail. Every photo she sent of what to expect were exact. She coordinated flowers, music & symblic ceremony. We had guests with dietary needs that the chef graciously prepared without any problem. We had 40 guests who were blown away with the staff, food and ambiance. I highly recommend the Rose Garden for your destination wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you like to be out of the city but be careful in pool with kids”
Reviews.Author: lucy20176
Reviews.Content: Rose Garden is a nice hotel but the staff at the front desk is snobby..which is funny given how expensive the hotel is you think you would have over the top service. It is right off the Via Venetto so unless you like shop, eat in fancy place or are visiting the american embassy you might want to look closer the city. You cannot just go out and walk attachtions at night. It has a pool in the basement but be careful if you have kids. When the jets are on the the suction that it causes will stick you to the bottom. I cannot stress how very dangerous this could be if a child or adult was to get stuck or have hair stuck. My 235 lb weight lifting husband had a hard time pulling one hand away when we tested it. I must admit that was a bit taken back by the black dots I found on the beds. It was enough not to unpack in my house but outside on deck when we returned home. Do your self a favor and don't eat dinner at hotel. Our meal was expensive and took almost 3.5 hours to serve. We started to watch our watches when we asked for things as simple as bread (22 minutes). We were the only ones eating.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shellyz
Reviews.Content: Friendly Staff. Great location...minutes from Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Clean, modern, and has character.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: BertrandofYork
Reviews.Content: Had to be in Rome on business for 2 weeks. 2 challenges: the trip came up a bit suddenly, so I had to find a hotel when many were already sold out. Second, I had to keep the price at around $300, a number which doesn't always get you a clean, quiet hotel with a requisite amount of A/C. I dove into TripAdvisor and the Rose Garden was very well reviewed. I can now add to those reviews. The hotel is super-clean and the rooms are big by Rome standards. The people at the front desk are helpful, polite and even borderline cheerful (one night, one of the receptionists was playing some skilled piano by the bar). The neighborhood is both close to the action, and yet it's on a quiet street -- as it's tucked two blocks off the bustling Via Veneto (where lots of the priciest hotels are). There's a nice restaurant with lots of windows so that one can enjoy the tranquil garden just outside, and there are also 4-5 tables out in the garden. Had all breakfasts there and they were a solid version of the standard hotel buffet. Attentive service at breakfast. Staff all very bilingual. There's a small but clean and well-lit gym and a small indoor pool that's probably ideal for kids maybe under 10. Would definitely stay here again. There are hotels with more age and grace and charm, such as the converted convent, the Donna Camille Seville hotel (where I spent my second week just to mix things -- and neighborhoods -- up). But this hotel, whose chinese-restaurant-sounding name and pre-rennovation mixed reviews probably keep people away, is a great option for vacation or biz.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch service and Location”
Reviews.Author: McNeeley
Reviews.Content: My wife joined me while in Rome for business and lost her luggage inroute. The staff went out of their way to make sure we got our luggage. They even upgraded us to a larger room since it's more appropriate for a couple. The rooms are small but have everything u need. There is a grocery store in the alley next to the hotel w affordable spirints and food. Hotel is near several sights and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: beachfront71
Reviews.Content: Note sure what to tell you except this hotel is: 1. Nice 2. Clean 3. Quiet 4. In a location that allows for walking to just about anything in rome.. We stayed part of our tip at a 5* hotel by the spanish steps and Rose Garden was niceer in all area's.. It is a block from VIa Veneto and the rooms are big. Great find as it is not mentioned on too many sites!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: RASMAN
Reviews.Content: This should be a 5 Star Hotel. Look no further. Perfect location near Spanish Steps and super restaurants. The staff are kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel in upmarket area”
Reviews.Author: NikhilMohta
Reviews.Content: The property is situated in what seems like an upmarket area of Rome with the US Consulate right across the road and 5-star properties like Westin, etc around the block. It is a 15-20 min walk from places of interest like the Spanish Steps or Fontana de trevi and further from the Colloseum but that's not a bit issue as taxis and buses are easily available. The hotel itself is a well designed and spacious property. We were staying in a Deluxe Double Room which was very well done up. The bathrooms are nice and there is a nice work-desk as well in case you need to set up your laptop. The staff is quite helpful with various things including tour bookings, directions, restaurants and general advice about Rome. The breakfast spread is pretty good as well and they can get you eggs, omelette, toast, etc upon request. All in all a pretty comfortable and nice property

Reviews.Title: “A potentially good hotel, spoilt by service”
Reviews.Author: holidaysaregreat999
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Rose Garden Palace on the 23/4/11 expecting great things. I booked the hotel based on its location and recent reviews on Tripadvisor. The front desk, on arrival, was initially helpful. We arrived at 11am so understandably the room wasn't ready. The receptionist was pleasant, but failed to inform us of anything the hotel had to offer. Nothing about where meals are served, the pool, nothing. Before going up to our room we had a coke each in the bar. The bar is actually a room leading onto the restaurant, at this time staffed by an officious member of staff who featured throughout our stay. We were served our drinks and a bill for approx. £12! Ridiculous. Our bags were taken up and we got into our room early, which was good. The room itself overlooked the street on the first floor. It was small, but ok for a city centre hotel. The bed was formed by two, very hard single beds pushed together, both wrapped in single bedding. Great. The bathroom was small but did have a decent sized bath and a powerful shower over the bath. The toilet flush was so annoying. You had to press it about 20 times to build up enough momentum for it to actually flush. Sounds trivial, but after 5 days it gets a bit wearing. The next morning we came down for breakfast to be greeted with total indifference. This is the general impression given by staff most of the time. No, it wasn't after breakfast had finished, in case you're wondering. We worked out it was serve yourself. No mention was made of where you could get toast. We gradually realised you had to order toast, much to the frustration of the breakfast staff. Other than breakfast, we had one evening meal in the hotel. It was very good quality, served by a friendly and efficient waiter. Like everything in this hotel though, it was too expensive. The final bill (one bottle of wine and only one dessert) was £135. Overpriced, especially as we had superior meals, in other restaurants locally, for half the price. We had cocktails after dinner in the bar (£14 each), where we were made to feel very much like an inconvenience. The staff were more concerned with noisily setting up tables to place the breakfast buffet upon and clattering the containers for cereal, as well as talking loudly to each other about their day. We just thought it was pretty rude really. The hotel is set in a nice area, with a 20 min walk to the Metro or the Spanish Steps. We really hoped for better and must have been unlucky based on previous feedback. It was as if the staff had all been given bad news and were going through the motions prior to the hotel being demolished! Our accommodation was £1500 in total (B&B) not including evening meal or cocktails. I didn't even get a thank you when I paid or 'have a safe trip', nothing whatsoever. We will not be returning, neither would we recommend this hotel if you want any decent level of service. One other thing to consider, the hotel advertises free Wi-Fi. This is patchy at best, I couldn't log onto it throughout (iphone) but my fiancee did manage to get very intermittent coverage for a maximum of 5 minutes at a time. Not good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: DAKonop
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel I have stayed in Italy. I had an associate staying in a different hotel that thought we were in a much better hotel and our expense was less. A true gem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ClausCanberra
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my (16 year old) son at the Rose Garden Palace for 5 nights and thorougly enjoyed it. Located strategically close to Via Veneto and not far away from the Metro station and most of Rome's attractions. Our second floor room was very nicely appointed facing the courtyard away from the street at the front of the building (and opposite the American embassy). Buffet breakfast was most welcome offering bacon/eggs and all the other trimmings. Free WiFI was most welcome (especially with a teenager in tow). Overall a most enjoyable stay and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Rome Experience”
Reviews.Author: kay_dubb_60
Reviews.Content: Loved, loved, loved this European hotel with it spacious room and incredible service staff. Room was spotlessly clean and very comfortable. Our room overlooked the American Embassy with amazing views of grounds and fascinating overview of security checks. Quick walk to shopping, major sights, and Metro. Only complaint is we couldn't stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, staff, breakfast and location.”
Reviews.Author: italylovingcanuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here celebrating 25th wedding anniversary after flying thru crazy Heathrow weather on December 20th. Room lovely, clean and sizeable, staff really understanding, kind and helpful. This place really is an oasis. Decor's lovely. Left for a week touring Florence and Sorrento, then returned for another 4 days at Rose Garden Palace before heading home. They had a wonderful New Year's Eve celebration included in our price, booked several tours for us, printed our boarding passes...really knew how to treat their guests. One minute from Via Veneto, Spanish Steps within walking distance, great shopping, restaurants. Would return to this hotel in a snap of the fingers and would send friends here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guy12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is totally renovated, very nice, near Via Veneto. Some of the rooms are smaller, but if you get a larger room, you will really enjoy the hotel. Breakfast is just OK. It deserves only 4 stars, but service of staff is exceptional. There are many restaurants nearby and you can walk to the center of Rome in 10-15 minutes. It will be "our" hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, large room”
Reviews.Author: swissmiss2010
Reviews.Content: I have seen that some people said that the room was cramped, but the one we were given was exceptionally large. It was a king size bed, with a living area and desk area, walk in closet and large bathroom. Since we were traveling with a small child, the size of the room was really appreciated. The reception staff was very friendly, although the restuarant staff could sometimes be a bit rude (I think they were annoyed with us having a child). The pool was a great way to end the long days. I would definitely recommend this hotel and if we ever go back, I will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “very classy, but choose a top floor room”
Reviews.Author: beerdrinker2005
Reviews.Content: Nice location just two block off via Veneto, Lots of nearby ATMS. Large taxi stand on next block. Nearby non-touristy restaurants include Brancaleone and Picollo Abruzzo. Comfortable lobby with small expensive bar on one side and dining area toward rear, Breakfast buffet with custom eggs. A few dining tables inside and a few on the covered patio. Double beds were a bit hard and pillows somewhat stiff. Some traffic noise but worse was loud noise from above wooden furniture being moved oven wood floors. A few felt pads would solve this irritant. Slamming doors were surprisingly loud for the layout of multiple hallways. Mini-fridge with only bottled water, possible complementary. WiFi worked OKAY. Staff was fine, fitness room untried. Overall a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “A nice clean well situated and stylish establishment”
Reviews.Author: AntonyV2
Reviews.Content: Ideal for stay of few days a short walking distance from the center. Nicely decorated,spacious rooms,a nice rose garden in sight from breakfast and polite people

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pcm2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and in a good area of Rome. Reception staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaAtlantagirl Posted by a Worldhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I've stayed in, ANYWHERE!. Staff goes out of their way to be accomadating. Yummy breakfast(included with room), delicious suppers. Room service(no charge for dinners, charge for breakfast)Across the street from the US Embassy, within walking distance of the local metro train system, Pool was a disappointment-it's underground so no view, no sunshine. The front desk people spoke and understood English very well. The others had enough skill, with our italian, to communicate :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: manndoe
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this hotel. It is perfectly situated steps from Via Veneto and a 10 minute (down hill!) walk to the Spanish Steps. The staff is incredible, they couldn't do enough for us. They reconfirmed our tours, booked dinner reservations and were really at our disposal for anything. Included breakfast was great...wonderful variety of food to choose from. The rooms were large and beautiful...beds a bit hard but if that's the worst thing a hotel has, then you're in pretty good shape. I would recommend this to anyone going to Rome and I would absolutely stay here again. Perfecto...molto bene!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in a fantastic location to explore the city. Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: JonnyNI
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Easter weekend with my girlfriend as a long overdue weekend treat and to have a base to explore Rome for the weekend. In short, the location is fantastic. Central, a 5 min walk to various underground stations, close to the big park if you want to go for a run in the morning and only 15 min walk to the Spanish steps. You can feel the quality of the hotel in everything that you touch. The rooms are great and we had fantastic sleeps in the luxurious bed and silent room. We tried out the swimming pool and sauna one evening and had it to ourselves which was lovely Stay here when in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Noicey Front”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravlerNaplesFL
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location near the Spanish Steps and Metro. We had a front room accross from the entrance to the U.S. Embasy. The noice from the Security ramp chains and the street traffic forced us to keep the windows shut during the night, despite the comfortable temperatures. The staff was very helpful with directions and business faxes that I neede to process. Beds were extremely comfortable and the air conditioning was efficient. Breakfast was very good, with a selection of cereal, eggs, breads and fruits. The area provides a large park, good restaurants, easy walk to the Metro and other sites. Make sure that you request a room in the back of this Hotel, away from the street and Embasy noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: LloydBishop
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Rose Garden Palace recently and it was a great experience. The rooms were large, the staff were great and we even had a great meal in the hotel restaurant out on the courtyard (my son said it was the best pizza of the 15 he tried over two weeks ...). Rooms were well appointed and quiet. My only (small) complaint was the wireless network was tough to use - but that allowed us to turn off the computers for a few days. Highly recommended - we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, chic hotel away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: fluff_astrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in early June, and had a very pleasant stay. While we were interested in seeing Rome on this trip, our main reason for traveling was for relaxation, so we knew we might be spending a decent amount of time lazing around our room. We chose the hotel because we heard they had "true" king beds, we could have a boutique hotel experience, and we could even use our AAA membership discount. Upon arriving, we were psyched to see that we had a large top-floor room and a bottle of champagne cooling in a bucket of ice. There was a walk-in closet, a good-sized bathroom, and a couch/sitting area. My partner was even more excited about the fact that we had blackout curtains so that he could sleep in late. I was happy for the robes and slippers (I ended up spending a lot more time in these and in the room than planned, since I got a bad cold on the trip). There was also a flatscreen TV with Sky cable available, but I can't really comment on this since we didn't use it. Throughout our stay, we had zero issues with noise. We're not sure if this was due to good soundproofing, or just that the people in the rooms around us were quiet. The staff was helpful before and during the stay. Before we arrived, I had been in touch with them via email to ask questions and set up reservations for restaurants and the Borghese Gallery. All of these emails they responded to within a day or two. They were also quite helpful during the stay and friendly, especially if I tried first to chat with them in Italian. Housekeeping was fast and kept everything clean and well-stocked. We both enjoyed breakfast, which was included with the room. I'll admit that I'm not a big breakfast person, but they had cereal and milk and coffee, and that's enough to make me happy. They also had a selection of fruits, meats, cheeses, eggs (albeit these looked a little orange) and bread. We also made use of the pool and the fitness center. The pool is nice, but be warned that it's more like a jacuzzi in terms of temperature. The fitness room is decent, one of each kind of equipment piece. Everything seemed to be in working order. Wifi, although free, was a little difficult to use. It took us a few tries to realize that the password you are given can only be used on one device at a time, so you need to request multiple passwords if you have multiple devices. The wifi itself was very weak. Wasn't a huge issue for us, but could pose an issue for business travelers. There's a small but handy grocery store right on the side street next to the hotel called "Despar." An affordable option for drinks or snacks. Bring as close to exact change as possible! They often can't change 20 or 50 EUR bills. And finally, location. Other reviewers have mentioned that it's a bit separated from the main sites of the city, and this is true. Just be forewarned about that before selecting a hotel in this area. We're really fit and love walking, so we ended up trekking to most of the sites, but it was a good 30-40 minutes to the Colosseum/Forum and about 20-30 to the Pantheon (in 90 degree heat ;)). On the upside, the Borghese park is right down the street and a safe place to take a stroll at all hours, and the Spanish Steps are also nearby. We can't comment on how accessible public transit is to the hotel's location, but cabs were easy to get. Restaurant-wise, there are only a few good places in the immediate area (Gina's near the Spanish Steps and San Marcos); for some of the better food, I recommend you head down to the main areas or Travestere. \ In summary... Pros: Good breakfast, spacious rooms (for the price), comfortable beds, friendly and efficient staff/housekeeping, gym and pool, safe, and blackout curtains! Cons: Located away from some of the sites, spotty wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great rooms, and friendly employees”
Reviews.Author: Travelsevenwonders
Reviews.Content: The Rose Garden was a great choice. The hotel is beautiful and has a precious little outside area to have an aperitivo. The only thing I can say is that if you have teenagers who like to go out, the location is not the best. Its very safe but its a distance from the downtown areas and paying for cabs every night can get very costly. Otherwise, Its perfect. I think any adult would be very happy here...Its the perfect place to come back after a looooong day of site seeing to put your feet up and relax. Oh and did I mention the AMAZING pool and sauna ;)

Reviews.Title: “Souless and Overated, Worst Breakfast Ever.”
Reviews.Author: mtsl2005
Reviews.Content: Having read the previous reviews on TA of this Hotel I booked it with high expectations, I was to be disappointed. There is a large armed Police presence in the area as the the Hotel is located adjacent the American Embassy and just off the Via Veneto, it must be said it is not close to any of the main historical sites you may wish to visit, the other guests when we were there were predominately American, On arrival the Receptionist was very helpful, we were shown to a well appointed room, there was good walk-in wardrobes with energy saving lighting complete with a safe and mini-bar which only contained two bottles of water, there was however no tea/coffee making facilities, the en-suite bathroom was a bit cramped and cluttered but everything was clean and in working order. We went for breakfast the next morning, it appeared that you had to find your own table in the Restaurant area as none of the Staff showed any willingness to welcome and assist, eventually a member of Staff ventured over and asked if we wanted coffee, that was it, communications over. The breakfast fare on offer was simply atrocious, if you wished something hot, then the choice was congealed "scrambled" egg, thin grease laden bacon and small sausages that stank when you bit into them, also there was no toaster. The fruit selection looked to be the same bowl each morning, with the none too plentiful bread, cheese and meat totally uninspiring and you end up wondering why you bothered to make the effort and not gone somewhere else, I guess you think it can't be like this everyday and must improve tomorrow. As you leave the Hotel front door turn left then first left again and you will find a SPAR Minimarket about 100 yds up that street, ideal for bringing back refreshments to your Room and make use of the near empty mini-bar. One incident I will leave you with is this: We took a taxi back from the Vatican, on arrival at the Hotel I asked the Driver what the fare was, he said 14 euros, I gave him a 20 euro note, he deftly switched this for a 5 euro note claiming this was all I had given him, knowing that I never had any 5 euro notes, I challenged him to drive to the nearest Police station to check if my fingerprints were on the note, needless to say he did not accept my challenge and I left the taxi to a torrent of verbal abuse, I would say either pay them with coinage or with the brown coloured 10 euro note, and make sure your travelling companion witnesses the payment.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome time at the Rose Garden”
Reviews.Author: Cabinownerwanabe
Reviews.Content: May 4th throught the 10th Our first time to Italy the staff at the Rose Garden could not have been nicer or more helpful. The rooms while small, are very comfortable and quite. The bathroom is very small but the shower is hot .The food was very good so much that we ate there several times over looking the rose garden. The breakfast that came with the room was fine. Fresh fruit everyday and rolls. They did have eggs and sausage and bacon too.The location was in a good location once we found our way around. Not too far from The Spanish steps around a 15 min. walk...It is right across from The US Embasy as well. We took several tours that worked out well I highly recomed that if it is your first time. We took a night time walking tour Trevi fountain etc... was great. We did have the travel issues looming over us which turned out to increase our time home by seveal hours... but were not canceled as some were... I hight recomed staying here I would again with out hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Romantic escape”
Reviews.Author: agregoire
Reviews.Content: What a gem! Excellent and friendly service on the door steps of Via Veneo. Very quiet, comfy bed, good nights are ensured. The rooms are big and well appointed. Have to love the wooden floor. Location is excellent, 5 mins from Via Veneto, 25 mins walk to Termini, 40 minutes to Plaza Venetia. Breakfast is good, if included in the rate, don't miss it. Wireless internet is free and fast. Just love it, don't look any further

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: elg820
Reviews.Content: Parquet floors, windows that actually open, big, airy rooms, great service. The hotel's within walking distance of Piazza Barberini (lots of restaurants and shopping), or several buses stop a few steps from the entrance. There's a taxi stand at the end of the street, so transportation is never a problem. There's also a grocery store right around the corner (the kind real people shop in, not tourists). They have a unique method for energy conservation: when you enter the room you must put your key card into the slot by the door or none of the lights will work (the bell hop will explain all this). So when you come into the room and see all the lights are on they really weren't - the maid service turns everything on before they leave and it goes out as soon as the door's closed. Thought that was a pretty neat way of handling guests who "forget" to turn their lights off. The only negative comment I have has to do with toiletries. In a word: bring your own. They offer shampoo but no conditioner, bubble bath but no shower gel and the lotion just leaves a film on your skin without hydrating anything. This is a wonderful hotel and if you can afford the price - stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: dannycarlucci
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. It has a modern lobby and bar area. The rooms were very nice. More modern than other hotels I have stayed at in Rome and Italy. The air conditioning was working, even in November, which was great since it was unseasonably warm. The bathroom was a bit on the small side, but workable. However, there was limited counter space. The only small nagging issue that I had with the room was in the walk in closet, which also contained the safe, the light had a motion detector which, for some reason, only gave you a few seconds of light before it turned itself off. The location of the hotel is great. It is two short blocks from Via Veneto and within walking distance of just about every site within Rome, other than the Vatican. It is also right across the street from the American Embassy, so security is very tight. There is a local grocery store just outside of the hotel which is extremely inexpensive. Large bottles of water were just 0.60 cents. To reach the store, just make a left out of the front door of the hotel and make a left at the corner. It is about 20 feet up on the right side of the block. Also, another block up, on the left side, is a nice, inexpensive cafe which sells good sandwiches and hot food for lunch. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again on future visits to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Rose Garden Palace”
Reviews.Author: JimmyJ7
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location, close to shopping, food, U.S. Embassy and Hard Rock Cafe. Very good service, bring mosquito repellant.

Reviews.Title: “Better Values Available in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sulfiteboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at this hotel while attending a conference at the U.S. Embassy. We received a special rate of 220 Euro pernight, but I would not recommend this hotel for that price. The room was clean and fairly nice, but pretty simple. The bathroom door didn't quite close properly. Other than that, the room was adequate. The breakfast was average for an Italian hotel. I also marked that it had no business center because the "business center" was one slow computer with no printer. The drinks at the hotel bar were very expensive (3 Euro for an espresso, 8 Euro for a beer). Some of the front desk staff were quite rude, particularly when I asked if they could book me tickets to the Vatican Museum. For a 4-star hotel and for the price, I expected better service. The bottom line is that it was an adequate hotel and very close to the Embassy, but not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “A compact, but well appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harlequin25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and young son. Very clean and well decorated. We stayed in a triple room, which was of a very good size (for a European hotel). Lower floors at the front of the hotel might suffer from traffic noise, but we are on a higher floor and it was not a problem. The hotel was not cheap, price wise, but in what is a very expensive city, it is probably good value for money. The staff were not the most friendly (excepting the door man, who was very helpful), but not in an off putting way. The area around the hotel seemed very safe to us. The food at dinner was very good, although due to lack of atmosphere we only ate at the hotel on one evening. Breakfast however was very average - something between a continental and an american buffet breakfast. It ended up being neither one not the other. Still, as breakfast was included in the room rate, we didn't mind too much.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in a great area”
Reviews.Author: emquad46
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Rose Garden Hotel at 9:45am on Oct. 7th. They offered us coffee in their restaurant and told us our room would be ready in 45 minutes. We were taken to our room at about 10:30am and were treated with professionalism. Our room was very large and included a sitting area as well as a living room area. A 37 inch HD flat screen TV could be viewed from the bed or living area. A walk in closet with lots of shelves and space was great. The bathroom was very modern and large. We had a wonderful dinner in the Rose Garden. The hotel is situated in a great area across from the US Embassy and in easy walking distance to the Spanish Steps and Villa Borghese. The staff was attentive, spoke English and could not do enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Short and Sweet!”
Reviews.Author: kgalli9544
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short and sweet...great hotel...nice and clean, great location, free internet, a very nice complimentary breakfast, and helpful staff. Stayed for six nights with my husband and two teenage daughters, ages 19 and 13. We all enjoyed our stay at the Rose Garden Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but you get whay you Pay for”
Reviews.Author: Chicagohotmama
Reviews.Content: Thi is such a great hotel! The rooms were a bit small but extremely clean. The staff was friendly and gave us great suggestions where to find great food. This was our second time in Rome. The first time we stayed at the Grand Palace Hotel..... another outstanding hotel! TheRose Garden hotel is located about two blocks from Via Veneto (Via Veneto is where you would want to be if you go to Rome) so, it walking distance to some great restaurant and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A nice way to end a European vacation”
Reviews.Author: Dewingsue
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great, safe location (near the American Embassy so plenty of security nearby). It is not a long walk to the Spanish Steps so this makes most things within walking or quick taxi ride. The rooms are large and very clean with great air conditioning but with windows that open which is great for Rome in Summer/Fall. Breakfast is very good with the exception they don't have a toaster however I'm sure if you ask they will toast bread for you. The gym area is very good with pool & amenities. Internet is free for hotel guests which is very much appreciated. Overall I would stay again as our stay was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant haven”
Reviews.Author: doctoryorki
Reviews.Content: Following a horrific incident of my purse being stolen with a necessary trip to the American Embassy, my family wanted to stay far away from the previous neighborhood. One of the workers at the Embassy recommended the Rose Garden Palace which was just around the corner. For the unexpected 4 day extension of our holiday, we were treated royally. The rooms were comfortable and clean, the area restaurants were great and the location could not be better. In the morning we could walk in the Villa Borghese and in the afternoons visit the shops near the Spanish steps. I would recommend this first class establishment to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a treasure”
Reviews.Author: romanholiday09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rose Garden Palace on our recent trip to Rome. It was our anniversary and the entire stay was memorable. It is rare to be a guest at a hotel for over a week and find no negatvies, no complaints, and no disappointments. But that's exactly what happened. The experience was incredible and I can clearly say this is one of the best values in Rome. It all started at the front desk, headed by the warm and welcoming and very capable Gabriele Selci and his very cheerful and helpful staff -( Massimo,. Barbara, people in the breakfast room). This service and warmth is second to none. You feel like you are at home. The rooms are lovely and well-appointed, some overlooking the American embassy - large bathrooms with fluffy white towels and many amenities. A plunge pool, sauna and fitness center are an added bonus. We were treated incredibly well with champagne in the room because it was our anniversary and just truly made to feel as though we belonged there. We have already spoken to many people about our 5 star experience at the Rose Garden Palace and look forward to returning next year. This is truly a treasure in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, elegant quiet and the restaurant is not to be missed!”
Reviews.Author: porscheduo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an utter gem! It's in quiet part of Rome in walking distance of the Villa Borghese and a couple of blocks from the Via Veneto. Service was excellent, rooms lovely and the best lunch we had in Rome was in their rose garden restaurant!!! The garden is a lovely little oasis in the middle of bustling Rome. Service was always with a smile and they got the details right. Recommend this hotel highly..

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: artanon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is simple, elegant and peaceful. It was a nice place to be at the end of the day. Nice, easygoing staff as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: MCWRS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights, booked through British Airways, (much cheaper rates) Very clean and in good decor. The rooms are very spacious with a large double bed. Breakfast was buffet style, plenty to choose from, pastries, cooked, cereal, fruit, breads. Helpful and willing staff. We ordered room service on the morning of my birthday which didn't arrive but after a phone call it soon arrived with sincere apologies and free of charge. We were also left a bottle of Champagne on ice in the room on our return from a day out site seeing. The hotel is within walking distance (20-30mins depending on your pace!!) of the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Also the metro station is a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “It "Comes up roses" at the Rose Garden Palace”
Reviews.Author: microbarny
Reviews.Content: General Manager Gabriele Selci and his staff run a very nice, smart and affable establishment. The staff is very friendly yet professional. The hotel is not stuffy/haughty; rather it is very comfortable - intimate - more informal with good amenities and good food. The location just off the Via Veneto (and next to the American Embassy) makes it quiet, safe yet convenient to shopping and mass transit. You can walk 1 minute to the Westin Hotel taxi stand and the Via Veneto, 5 minutes to the Underground and 15 minutes to the Villa Bourghese and its park. The taxi's know where the hotel is too so you don't have to work hard at explaining where you want to go at midnight...And since it isn't on the Via Veneto itself it is a better value. All-in-all, we can recommend this hotel to those who want a smaller more intimate hotel with friendly but professional service and a good location at a more reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “They deserve 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyerJay
Reviews.Content: I feel like we really lucked out with this hotel - a 5 star experience at a 4 star price. It's a beautiful hotel in a great, high-end location (just off Via Veneto). And the service is better than many 5 star hotels - very responsive and with a friendly and pleasant attitude - including the staff in the bar and restaurant, as well as the reception clerks.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings for Rose Garden Palace”
Reviews.Author: muppetshow
Reviews.Content: We booked the Rose Garden after reading the many glorious reviews on this site, and I must admit we were slightly disappointed. Maybe we got our hopes up too much, maybe the poor euro/pound exchange rate tainted our stay, or maybe we are just a little unfamiliar with high Rome prices - either way we didn't feel this hotel was as reasonable as others had made out. We shopped around before booking and found a rate of about €175 per room per night (about £175 per night due to the current exchange rate). It pays to shop around as some sites were charging double this. However, this did not include breakfast which, had we wanted, would have been an additional €15 per person per night. Many of the hotels and cafes within walking distance offered breakfast for a similar rate; a 15 minute walk towards the city centre took us to a variety of cafes serving cappuccinos and croissants for a fraction of the price. We found the reception staff friendly enough, although the hotel seemed deserted! Maybe it was the time of year - the weekend before Christmas - but throughout our four night stay we only saw two other guests! The pool area was lovely, though very small and intimate if you happen to turn up the same time as anyone else, as there are only two loungers. But just to have an indoor pool & sauna in the centre of Rome was a luxury in itself. The rooms were fairly spacious and very clean, though some items of furniture were looking rather tired. And the bathroom was lovely despite the heavily chipped marble around the tub. Being six months pregnant and a true tea-drinking Brit I was a bit disappointed that there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room - returning to our room for a hot drink, feet up, at the end of a tiring day would have been nice. I know we could have asked room service, but at €12/£12 for two hot drinks it was one expense too many! Oh yes - and the 'free' mini bar. Not so free, actually. Ours wasn't even switched on, so all the drinks were warm and they weren't free at all! From what I recall I think a small 500ml bottle of water was €5, and a Coke was €6! There was a Spar right around the corner selling chilled 1.5l water for 0.20€ - much better! Don't get me wrong, I'm not a cheapskate. Over the years we have stayed in various places - from 2 star budget Travelodges to 5 star hotels and we like to treat ourselves when we go on holiday. However, we didn't feel like this was the bargain everyone seemed to make out - even though overall it is a nice hotel and I would consider staying there again, should we return to Rome. Next time though, I'll definitely pack a travel kettle!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: brooklyngirl22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rose Garden Palace in October and was so impressed. I was delighted to find a great mix of travelers at the hotel and a very international atmosphere. I am no stranger to Rome, and having stayed at a variety of hotels over the years I would say that the combination of price, style, location, and professionalism here was special. The hotel is in a renovated palazzo just off the Via Veneto, within a short walk to the Spanish Steps. Being in Rome on business, it was easy for me to get to any point in the city for my appointments and for sightseeing. The staff at the reception desk was invaluable at helping with directions, train and bus routes, and restaurant recommendations. I love the decor of the hotel. The rooms are spacious, decorated in a soft contemporary style, elegant in an unobtrusive way, and everything works! The minibar has water and soft drinks only, but they are complimentary. I thought this was a great idea considering how much some hotels charge for minibar items. If I wanted a cocktail I went down to the wonderful lounge and sipped my drink either with other guests or outside in the rose garden. Yes, there really is a rose garden. The food at the hotel requires special mention. I have eaten many a buffet breakfast in hotels throughout Italy. Many of them rather ho-hum. On the contrary, here you will find an impressive spread including fresh breads, freshly cut-up fruit salad, huge wedges of cheeses, and, best of all, homemade tarts and pastries. I also recommend having lunch or dinner in their in-house restaurant. I invited friends to dinner there and we all enjoyed it tremendously. The service was attentive and professional. The food was great. There is a fitness room and lovely zen-like pool in the lower level of the hotel, which is also complimentary to guests. After a day walking your feet off in Rome, a dip in that pool was divine. I recommend the Rose Garden Palace to all types of travelers, business, leisure, even families. The location is great, the atmosphere is relaxing (which is a plus in a city like Rome!) and all the comforts you want are there. Overall, it's hard to beat. Take it from an experienced traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shantishanti7
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Rose Garden Palace when I was in Rome on business last month, and it was great. For my money, there's not a better place to stay anywhere else in Rome. The rooms are spacious and beautifully appointed, and the baths are modern and comfortable. I particularly loved the bath -- luxury fixtures like the rain showerhead and separate hand-held shower are head and shoulders above what you usually find at a European hotel at this price point. Nice thick towels and bathrobes too! Breakfast at the restaurant was great. The staff was attentive without being intrusive, and the buffet spread included an array of food that's not usually found at Italian breakfast buffets -- eggs, bacon, etc. There was nice selection of fruits and breads, as well as cold cuts and cheese. When I was there, the breakfast room was full of travelers from all around the world, and it was pretty clear that there was something for everyone at the buffet table. It's also worth noting that everything in each room's minibar is free for guests, which is a happy surprise given that many Italian hotels charge crazy prices for drinks you take from the minibar. The Rose Garden Palace's location just off Via Veneto is perfect for exploring the city, with the Spanish Steps and many other sights within easy walking distance. The staff was great about helping with directions, maps and public transportation schedules. From them, I learned about the little electric bus (116) that leaves from around the corner of the hotel and stops at great locations all around Rome. I was at the hotel for several days, and every interaction I had with the staff was a pleasure. If you're a frequent traveler to Rome, you'll appreciate the Rose Garden Palace's great location and quality. For people who've never visited Rome before, I think the Rose Garden Palace would be a great place to stay as you get your bearings and get comfortable with the city and culture. Rome can seem overwhelming sometimes, and the Rose Garden Palace is a wonderful oasis in a great part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: DJDJColorado
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a rather busy street in the government/finance district of Rome. Staff was rather dismissive and uninterested in providing assistance. The room was nicely appointed and was a moderate size, however with all of the furniture that had been stuffed into it was very tight with large luggage. It was nice that they provided one computer that had a free internet connection, however, it took 10 minutes to get a code that worked from the front desk. The breakfast was the best part of the stay, although the rose garden isn't the spectacular place that I was hoping for. There were also a LOT of Americans staying here- some might feel that this is a good thing, but I do not look for this when travelling. For a luxury hotel, I do not feel that this delivers.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoeMPalmSprings_Ca
Reviews.Content: Just to be clear-some good points here, nice big rooms, clean, good accomodations. Just beware of the unfriendly and incompetent staff. Our large extended family stayed at the hotel this month taking 8 rooms for a Rome reunion. A week before arrival, well before the 2 day cancellation period, one member of our party had to cancel their room which was guaranteed on my credit card. We were advised in writing by Carmen the Rez Manager that all reservations were cancelled, nevertheless were hit with a $797 penalty for not cancelling in time ! When pressed, staff just held to their guns and said things were "confusing" to them. Presented with proof in the form of cancellation numbers, the staff then professed the lack of authority to take care of the problem. We have filed a dispute with our credit card company. Also, extremely rude dining room Manager at breakfast, brusquely telling us to clear our tables for the next party. Some front office personnel are friendly but others unspeakably rude. When my sister asked the staff for a new room key as hers was deactivated, the employee threw his hands up in the air and just told her she was "terrible." When you pay over $500 a night you expect better service than this. I'd stay at a Motel 6 before returning to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: PrivateWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay in the Rose Garden Palace Hotel. The staff were exceptionally friendlyand friendly. It was my husbands birthday during our four night stay and the hotel left a bottle of "Champagne" in our room with their compliments. Would certainly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lots to love about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveler20005
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly across from the American Embassy and minutes (literally, 10 minutes) from the Spanish Steps in a lovely neighborhood. The room wasn't ready when we arrived, but that worked to our favor: we were upgraded to a beautiful suite with a king-sized bed! The staff were professional and courteous (but, not stellar like you can expect in other multi-star hotels in the world). However, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. At around $480 per night, this place ain't cheap. But, it's very clean and hospitable, everything worked (well, almost everything -- the TV was needlessly complicated), and the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dlk444
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful tour of Italy. All of our hotels were great but the Rose Garden was superior. The entrance to the hotel is not flashy but very inviting. Our rooms were the best part. One of our two rooms was nice, considering that we were in Europe. But, the second room was amazing. The room was the largest we've seen in space-crunched Europe. The room had a walk-in closet, sitting area, and spacious bed. The square footage could rival many apartments in New York City. The bathroom was also well-equipped. The drinks in the room were free which was great because nothing could beat a cold Coke after a long day of walking. Another great characteristic of the hotel was the great location. We walked everywhere, except for Vatican City. It was a great way to walk off the amazing gelato and pasta. We always felt safe in the somewhat upscale area. Great restaurants are steps away. The service was very professional and made great recommendations. The breakfast was also pleasing. It was not only continental, it included hot eggs and bacon. The Rose Garden Hotel was a superior hotel that offered great location, service, and hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Modern Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oliverhenry
Reviews.Content: Our hotel stay here was great! The rooms clean, breakfast was great. The room included mini-bar. The Front desk Staff was so helpful. The service was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maytime17
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Rome, during which I was celebrating a milestone birthday - and what a wonderful time I had! The hotel was everything it promised to be from the pictures on the website. I have a thing about cleanliness and the Rose Garden Palace Hotel certainly met my exacting standards! Having checked out a couple of guide books before my trip and their comments about breakfasts in hotels in Rome, I wasn't expecting such a great breakfast as that which was provided by the RGPH. There was a good variety and it was very tasty. All the staff I met during my staff were extremely professional, polite and always had a smile. As a solo traveller I certainly felt very comfortable staying at the RGPH; and having thrown a coin in the Trevi Fountain I certainly hope to go back to Rome and to the RGPH. Thank you for a lovely stay....

Reviews.Title: “Real Class”
Reviews.Author: southern76
Reviews.Content: The Rose Garden Palace is a wonderful hotel. Everything was great. The room, the food and the hotel staff. They helped with everything. Coming from the US was not sure what to expect, but everything was great. The rooms are lovely. The bathrooms were spacious and clean. Expensive, but worth it. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: lisalisa77
Reviews.Content: The Rose Garden Palace was a beautiful hotel. Our room was absolutley gorgeous, we were on our honeymoon and upgraded to a suite with a huge walk in closet and beautiful decor. The location was about a 10 minute walk to the top of the spanish steps, we definiltey did a lot of walking. Overall it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: c2watkins
Reviews.Content: What can I say about Rose Garden Palace? It was a brilliant hotel! Firstly the lobby/reception area is lovely and large with ample seating (excellent when you've just had a long plane journey) and the reception staff are very welcoming with good english. Our room was large with ample storage space. Lovely clean bathroom with bath and seperate shower head over it with lovely pressure (a rareity in most hotels I find - usually it's just a pathetic drip) We found the free mini bar a nice touch which was restocked every day with fresh bottled water, coke, apple juice etc. Also I found it quite nice (and a novelty) to have the bath bubble etc restocked everyday as well. We could fault nothing with this hotel, the service was excellent, the location was great, breakfast was lovely (and went on until 11am!) it was clean and had everything you could want. The price was excellent for what you got and I would definatley recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kwnNy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long stay at the rose garden palace. It was perfect. We had the family suite on the 4th floor which gave us a large master bedroom and an attached smaller bedroom that they placed 2 twin beds in for our 2 young teens. The hotel was quiet, elegant and lovely. The staff was extremely helpful in helping us make arrangements for tours and transportation before we even arrived and made many dinner reservations for us while we were there. The breakfast was delicious - a nice assortment of cereals, cheese, meats, fruit salad and their delicious coffee. It was an easy way to begin a day with children. The only downside (which is also a plus) is that it is tucked into a neighborhood on the edge of the area a typical sight seer is going to visit. We found that most of the restaurants we wanted to try were closer to the pantheon or trevi fountain. So we probably took a few extra cabs ... but it was so quiet and relaxing and comfortable that it was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Take time to smell the rose”
Reviews.Author: MelisaInDallas
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in peaceful location near Spanish steps. Front desk was helpful in trying to locate my husbands lost luggage. A fabulous full breakfast in the lovely garden was served each day. Our room was quite large for a typical Rome hotel and had a balcony. Will definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy and in keeping with Rome”
Reviews.Author: BellaVeronica
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the end of January at the Rose Garden Palace and loved it. The staff are very helpful and speak good English, the room was lovely and very clean and the breakfasts were great, especially the coffee. The only thing we missed was tea/coffee making equipment in the room! Adored Rome, got in as much siteseeing as possible in 3 days, loved the Colloseum, loved the Vatican, saw the pope on Sunday.....hated the food! I was soooo looking forward to eating in Rome, but it was nothing like the Italian food we are used to in England and where we ate it was very expensive! Going back again in October :))

Reviews.Title: “a haven of calm”
Reviews.Author: CathyECyprus
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at the Rose Garden Palace. I simply could not fault the service, standards and amenities for a small city hotel. Situated in the Via Venito area Northern Rome, it is a ten minute walk from the nearest Metro station. There is a taxi rank 50metres from the entrance and an average ride anywhere in the city was around €8. The relaxing spa area was very welcome after a day sightseeing and the breakfast was excellent with a choice of continental and english to get your day off to a good start. The bar was comfortable and although drinks are expensive they have a happy hour between 5-7pm. I would recommend this hotel to mature couples, we will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Come and smell the roses”
Reviews.Author: teasyweasy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 3 night break in Rome, our first visit. This hotel was perfect, the service was brilliant, didn't bother you but if you needed anything it was attended to immediately. The room was very clean and the small attention to detail made all the difference. The location was superb, in the middle of everything, 5 minutes away from the Spanish Steps and 10 from the Trevi Fountain, I guess it took about 20 to reach the Coliseum. We decided on the second evening to eat at this hotel, the food was wonderful and they even gave us an antipasti "on the house", not a bad price too for a major city hotel. If you need an organised trip they can arrange that too. When we checked out at midday they took good care of our luggage until our evening flight home with no extra charge or fuss.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, great bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: arthurelliot
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Rose Garden Palace. It is convenient to many of the things a person would want to see in Rome. The lobby was very nice, including the breakfast area. My breakfast was included in the price, and i enjoyed it each day. In terms of the room, mine was smaller and had only a view of a courtyard. Also the bed was two twins pushed together (and they were hard), but after a long day this didn't bother me much. The bathrooms were excellent though - especially for Europe! It had a wonderful tub and shower, plenty of space, and nice marble floors. The staff were friendly and willing to resolve any problems or issues.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: AquariusNantucket
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Rose Garden Oct 22-24 2007. I am a travel agent and have sent many clients. I wanted to experience for myself. I brought two other couples. We all loved the hotel. The location is perfect. Just across from the American Embassy. We all had different room types. They were all lovely and spacious. We found the breakfast experience very intimate with a delicious array of cold and hot foods and wonderful coffee. They have a small health club and large elegant hot tub area. The front desk staff was very pleasant and accomodating. I can see why I have 100% success when I send my clients. The price is very reasonable by Rome standards. I will stay there any time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dcuzzi1962
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on a Perillo Tour this past June and had a great time! We stayed at the Rose Garden Palace Hotel in Rome and absolutely loved it. This hotel is in such a great location, the staff spoke great English and were very accommodating. The breakfasts were wonderful!!! I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “my cuppa tea!”
Reviews.Author: Shi Hu
Reviews.Content: We decided to revise our plan for our return to Rome at the end of a month's travel in Southern Italy and Sicily and stay here instead of V. San Pio. We found this hotel more comfortable. Our room 207 was large enough with a spacious closet and bathroom with a welcomed tub in which to relax my tired feet at the end of a long day of walking. During our week, we always found fresh towels on our return from dinner left by an unobtrusive housekeeping staff. The room was quiet as was the well-functioning AC. It is a relatively small hotel with a professional, helpful and courteious staff. Breakfasts were impressive in the modern, Roman-style lobby. In addition, we appreciated free access to the internet. By the way, we did ask for the "senior rate" and we were reimbursed for two tickets to the Borghese Galleria and Museo which I had reserved before leaving the states. As for the location just off the Via Veneto, it was not too far from many must-see sights, perhaps a 20 minute walk to the Pantheon, for example. The restaurant was acceptable. The San Marco Restaurant ,only several blocks away, was a quite good, popular neighborhood trattoria.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Excellent Room”
Reviews.Author: boomer_f_16
Reviews.Content: Outstanding staff and outstanding service. I travel all over Europe and the staff at this hotel were some of the best I've seen. Excellent room and well laid out. Great location in Rome for business or pleasure travel. Outstanding places to eat...all within a few minutes walk of the Rose Garden Palace. Write to me if you have any questions: bill jones boomer_f_16@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “In case you're like I was and need to know if Rose Garden is worth it.”
Reviews.Author: maggieor
