Reviews.Content: Okay, so if you're reading this review then you're like I was -- desperately trying to figure out WHERE to stay while in Rome. Here's my take on the Rose Garden Palace: it's the perfect place to stay if you're an independent traveler and don't expect to be "pampered" with services like you'd get at most "4 star" hotels in the states. I’ve given the Rose Garden 5 stars because for me, it was a perfect stay for what I wanted: an awesome room, great location, safe place (for a woman traveling alone), and good food. That’s Rose Garden in a nutshell. The room was tremendous. The photos that I’ve posted really don’t do the room justice. The room I had was massive in terms of European standards, and even large for US standards. HUGE walk in closet and dressing area. The bathroom was beautiful and spotlessly clean with robe and slippers provided. The shower was large and spacious with a deep tub and strong water pressure. The housekeeping staff seemed to have monitored my room every time I left. I ALWAYS had new soaps, shampoos and bubble bath every time I returned to the room. The breakfast was TERRIFIC with a large and varied choice of things to eat (buffet style) such as eggs and bacon, cereals, breads, muffins, croissants, juice, yogurt, fruit, juices, etc., etc. It's not "made to order", so for any "foodies" out there, you might find it disappointing. But it's enough food that you could skip lunch and keep you until dinner. The location was perfect… close to Termini station and right across from the US Embassy. You couldn’t get much safer, and although I had a room on “streetside” I didn’t hear a sound. Perfectly quiet. So, if you want a good night’s sleep, you’ll sleep like a baby here. They have a nice gym and pool. Granted, it’s on the smallish side, but nonetheless, after a day in the sun, it sure is nice to return to the hotel and take a dip in the pool. My suggestion if you stay here is to not expect much from the staff. It’s simply not too service oriented. It’s not that there wasn’t service, it’s just not found throughout the staff. Half are hugely helpful, the other half do the bare minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: voyageur1991
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely adorable! I was there for 4 nights and I really loved it! It was a very modern hotel, and the rooms were so large (up to Europpean standards)! We had a sofa and an armchair in our room. The bathroom is very clean and of good taste. We were near the elevators but that wasn't a problem, they are very quite. The breakfast was fresh and enjoyable and the restaurant was good. Try pastas with pesto: D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S!!! The staff was really helpful and kind (I was anticipating them to be dull as other reviewers stated). Ask for restaurant recommendations and they will give you places not so commercial that are of course really good. But we asked one night for a dinner at the Trevi fountain and we had our best dinner (not the food but the ambiance) altough the food was good... Grill and Wine.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern hotel, staff not very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Stephanielowe
Reviews.Content: There isnt anything to complain about reagrding the hotel. Its facilities, rooms, location were all wonderful! We loved the decor and intimate, quiet feel of this hotel. It was a wonderful refuge from the hustle and bustle of Rome. Our one complaint: the staff was rude and snotty! The check in process was handled by an extremely rude man. He rolled his eyes when we asked him how to get to the Pantheon and gave us a horrendous recommendation for dinner. UGH! Watch the staff....

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: misty12n
Reviews.Content: I searched for over 2 months to find a hotel suitable for our family of 4 Based on the reviews in tripadvisor I called the hotel directly and booked a room We arrived around late morning, and were warmly greeted, offered cappaccinos, and given an upgrade to a junior suite on the 5th floor. After the bags were delivered, they followed up with a bottle of champagne. The room was large, and the view was nice. Since we were on the 5th floor, the windows could be kept open. The beds were great, the closet fabulous, and we appreciated the minibar which was filled up each day. The bath was small, but very clean. Breakfast was superb!! Each morning we were asked if we wanted coffee, cappacciono, etc. There was fresh-squeezed juices, eggs, bacon, sausage, pastries, cereal, what more could you want? The weather was perfect to sit outside and people watch. The kids loved the pool and the sauna. The only draw back was the bar(I forgot to warn my husband about the prices) There is a great restaurant around the corner , the pomodoria?? it means tomato in italian cant remember exact spelling it is family owned and was good . The hotel was in a great location Very quiet and high-class Every day we wouldwalk all the way down to the colloseum and back.(about 30 min) Only needed a taxi for the Vatican. Overall,although a bit pricey,(hey, what isn't in Rome) this hotel was fabulous and i would definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingF00ls
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in early August 2007. I have stayed at the Westin Excellsior and the Mariott (both on the Via Veneto) previously. I would stay here again without a doubt. The rooms are superior to those other properties. Large (in european standards), Super Clean, Good Bed and Linens, Free Mini-Bar (no alcohol and you have to ask to be refilled every day), Free Wi-Fi. Service at front desk was good, Barbara and Max are especially helpful. This is a boutique style property and the staff tends to wear many hats. The buffet breakfast was very good. I would agree with a previous post about a little bit of indifference from one of the two servers in the breakfast area. She always seemed to be a bit bothered. We were on vacation so I didn't let it bother me. I booked thru Travelocity and it eneded up costing us 236 euros per night inclusive of taxes. Hotel is across the street from american Embassy so it is very secure and only one block from the Via Veneto and the Westin Excellsior Hotel. All in all this is a new property, well maintained and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, service was indifferent”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLori
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at the Rose Garden From July 29 - August 2, 2007. We were booked into a "family room", which is really two separate rooms connected by a small hallway, this little suite then has it's own common entrance to the hotel corridor. The rooms were spacious; one was a junior suite with a king-sized bed and large desk as well as a separate sitting area with a pull out couch (more on that below). The other room was a fair sized room with a king bed. Both rooms had lovely modern travertine bathrooms and walk-in closets. Rome was very hot during our stay and my children swam in the indoor pool nearly everyday - that was a real treat. The breakfast buffet (included in the room price) was extensive. In addition to the standard continental fare, there were eggs, sausages, bacon, fresh fruit, cereals and wide assortment of beverages. The staff, while not unfriendly, were rather indifferent. Once seated at breakfast it was difficult to get the attention of the waitstaff. Breakfast was served with one small pot of coffee (really about the equivalent of two small cups) and I was never able to get the attention of a waitress for a refill. In addition, we were never provided with linens for the pullout couch, despite asking for them EVERY DAY. So truthfully, the pullout couch was unusable as a bed. On the whole, the property was very nice, the rooms well-appointed and the food quite good. We paid 550 euros for the family room, which I thought was good value, given that it was really two nice sized double rooms. The indifferent service was a real let down, and because of that I probably would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rose Garden - Perillo Tour”
Reviews.Author: jsteinNy
Reviews.Content: Booked a perillo tour - stayed at the rose garden palace while on the tour. This hotel is absolutely gorgeous! Very chic - staff is personable. The food is out of this worls - huge breakfast selection. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: blackcap
Reviews.Content: Lovely smart presented hotel. Had huge room on the 5th floor. It was a treat to have a hotel room with its own walk in wardrobe and plently of mirrors. We were able to store all our luggage in the wardrobe out of the way. There were ample amounts of drawers and hanging space. The room had a huge bed, a writing desk, a sofabed, coffee table and arm chair. There was plenty of space. The bathroom had a bath/shower, but there was a double curtain to ensure that water didn't leak onto the bathroom floor. The bathroom had a speaker so that you could hear the TV in the bathroom. There was a bottle of sparkling wine for us on arrival, which was a lovely surprise. The turndown service included a pair of slippers each, next to the bed. The breakfast wasn't the best we had come across on our trip. There wasn't much fruit to choose from. The breakfast was especially disappointing if you happened to turn up a bit late. The location was a bit away from the main sights of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended - quiet area”
Reviews.Author: Esquimalt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights in late May 2007 at the Rose Garden Palace relying on reviews from TipAdvisor. We highly recommend the hotel. We booked using the hotel website at their posted rate of 300 euros per night including breakfast. The reservations were efficicently handled. As well, we aranged for car service at the Rome airport for 65 euros through the hotel. After some 20 hours of travel, we were pleasd to have had the private car service direct to the hotel and thought the cost reasonable - we recommend this. On arrival at the hotel we were greeted by freindly and professional desk staff . We were given room 209 which is, I believe, a "deluxe" room. It was very clean, pleasant and of reasonable size. The safe and satelite TV were welcome amenities. The bathroom was very clean and serviceable (e.g., lots of water pressure and hot water) although quite small, given that it included a bidet. The hotel is located in a quiet part of the city and the room overlooked their inner courtyard, so it was very quiet. Bed was reasonably comfortable. The breakfast buffet offered a wide selection of hot and cold items, that should satisfy any North American. The breakfast room staff promptly served coffee and were sufficiently attentive. The room itself is very pleasant and is also used for a lounge and dinner - a nice quiet place to have a drink after a day of sight-seeing or business. On our last night we had dinner at the hotel. We didn't expect much, given it was a hotel dining room, but were delighted by the quality of the food (appetizers, mains, desert and wine) and the cordial yet unobtrusive service. It was the best meal we had in Rome and we had a number of good meals in Rome. We also used the gym, located in the basement near but separate from the pool. It's a clean and adequately equipped - certainly OK for a workout while travelling. We didn't use the pool, but heard comments that it was cold. The Rose Garden Palace is located somewhat out-of-the-way from the main tourist sights, although close to the wonderful Villa Borghese . That was fine for us, we walk a lot and walk quickly, e.g., 20 minutes to the Forum, under 10 minutes to the nearest subway. We walked everywhere except to St. Peter's. We thought the location was ideal but it might be incovenient for some. We very much enjoyed our stay at the Rose Garden Palace. All staff that we encountered were porfessional, coutreous and had a genuien interet in service. All spoke English but no doubt appreciated (or amused by?) our stumbling attempts at speaking Italian. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Things you would not expect”
Reviews.Author: JB4
Reviews.Content: I recently have visited Rome for a 4 night short break with my wife and my 12 year old son.I decided to stay at the Rose Garden Palace based on location and previous reviews.Yes it is in nice, quiet location opposite the American Embassy. Yes the bedrooms are spacious and well air conditioned. Yes the hotel is expensive and one would expect minimum standards of a 4 star, luxury hotel. These minimum standards were unfortunately not reached. On arrival had to carry our 4 items of luggage to our bedroom ourselves. The mini bar was free which consisted of a bottle of water, diet coke,tonic water and another bottle of juice. Not a great choice.This was basically a fridge which was not cold..The heated towel rail in the bathroom did not work either. The biggest moan was the service at breakfast. The breakfast room was nice and choice good but the service was NON EXISTENT. We would turn up for breakfast and then look for a suitable table.There were 2 female members of staff who paid no attention to you. I managed to get 1 good morning from the breakfast manager on the last day who had been off the previous day.We would then take our seat and help ourselves to the breakfast. No one would approach us and ask if we would like coffee or tea. After 15 minutes I would ask for some coffee and tea. There would be no acknowledgement from the staff. Again we would wait 10 min...it would eventually arrive normally without milk and you would have to ask again for the missing items. There was no please of thankyou from these staff and when you asked for toast, well they seemed that you were inconveniencing them. Another wait and then 10 minutes later the toast would arrive. On the third day I mentioned these facts to reception and then the front of hotel duty manager the next day. There was not really an apology or mention of how these problem was going to be addressed. A shame that a nice hotel is let down by the rudeness of the staff at breakfast time.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: sinsf
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 4 night stay at the Rose Garden Palace Hotel. What a gem! I booked this on the recommendations I read on trip advisor and I was not disappointed. Located just off the Via Veneto, it was about a 5-10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and right across the street from the American Embassy. The service was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was definitely 4 stars in rating. The rooms were well appointed and very clean. Lovely marble bathroom, with heated towel rack. While the room was not huge, it had a great walk in closet and comfortable bedding. I loved the remote control curtains with controls located next to each side of the bed. Another nice touch was the complimentary minibar in the room with waters and juices restocked daily. The workout room was small but sufficient with 1 treadmill, 1 bike, 1 rowing machine, 1 elliptical machine and some free weights and a few different weight machines. There was a dry sauna as well as a plunge pool. The daily breakfast, included in the price of the room, was fantastic. It was served daily from 7-11 so it fit in to about any plans we had made. The breakfast selection included eggs, meats, great cheeses, dry cereals, juices, breads, fruits and tea and coffee. Whenever we arrived down for breakfast, we were always immediately attended to and offered coffee. They gladly made delicious cappuccinos too. Just down the block from the hotel is a taxi stand so we could always easily catch a taxi anywhere we needed to go. The fare was no more than 9-10 Euros anywhere within the city. There are many restaurants in quick walking distance from the hotel and we always felt safe walking around. While this hotel is not right in the center of all of the sights, it was a lovely refuge at the end of our busy days. I would definitely go back to the Rose Garden Palace Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: KingTito
Reviews.Content: Very clean, very nice hotel. Great breakfast, comfortable bed, nice shower. Bathroom was impeccably clean but very small. Nice touches like a fruit bowl in the room, a weather card detailing the forecast were nice. Would definitely stay again. Breakfast was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique with great location!”
Reviews.Author: somedayTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for a week - loved it! Details, details, details! My curtains opened at a touch of a button by my bedside. I had a dressing area with multiple mirrors. Bathrooms are small yet luxurious, with huge marble baths drapped with lush fabrics. Gorgeous furnishings and pleasant arwork. Breakfast was a marvelous spread. I felt like I could really relax and be pampered at this hotel. Location is ideal with massive selection of restaurants around the corner. Romantic, sleek, and comfortable. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moushy
Reviews.Content: The Rose Garden Palace is situated on a quiet street just off the Via Veneto. The hotel is modern, stylish, well run and best of all, extremely well maintained and clean. The room we had was a good mix between style and comfort. It was well decorated, airy and quiet. The room and bathroom, although by no means large, did not feel cramped. There were good features such as air conditioning and an excellent walk-in closet (with safe) - and touches such as black-out blinds and TV speakers in the bathroom. There were also several english tv channels including BBC World News, CNN, Fox and National Geographic. There was room service available (although each time we tried, little mistakes were made - like forgetting the tea bags for the tea). The breakfast was buffet style with a good selection of cooked or continental choices and was available until 11am. The hotel is well situated - especially if you like to just walk out your room and go for an evening meal (there are lots of good places along the via veneto). You can walk to the Spanish Steps within 20 minutes but, for the Colloseum or Vatican you may need to take public transport. Overall, we found this to be an excellent short stay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYR29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Rose Garden as part of our 3 tour jump in Itay. This was our first stop on our 2 week Honeymoon. We really didnt know what to expect being havent traveled to Europe. Well let me tell you... This is one of the best hotels I have ever been to. It reminded us of a cozy mid town NY hotel with class up the.. well you know what.. Anyway, great front desk, beautiful area ( near all the attractions in Rome ) We both had a great time and we will return soon. If you are wondering on where to stay for your Rome vacation, please, dont let this place pass you by. The only thing that i didnt like was that there is only one TV station that is in english.. Other then that, your good to go. :P

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room a little bit of luxury!”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsG
Reviews.Content: A fabulous Hotel to stay in for that something special. We upgraded as It was our Honeymoon to the Junior Suite which was fantastic. Huge Room , Complimentary Mini-Bar (Soft Drinks Water etc!) and Massive beds. The Staff were extremely helpful with directions, recommendations etc and spoke perfect English!. Breakfast was simple( Cereals, breads. jams etc, Some Hot Bacon egg and sausage .) But enjoyable and a good thing was it was served until 11. No Need For taxi's(although there is a taxi rank just outside the hotel or they will call a cab from reception for you) all the main sights within comfortable walking distance except the Vatigan Mueseum. But use your map the streets look all the same.No early morning wake up calls!. Definately recommend it for that special occasion or just for that little bit of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Spent a wonderful weekend in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stout21
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading various reviews and we did not regret it. The hotel is situated 200 meters behind the famous Via Veneto, slightly away from all the hustle and bustle of Rome. The room we received was enormous and very elegant with an ante-chambre and a bathroom in marble. For an Italian hotel the breakfast was very large with a wide choice of meats, cheeses, breads, fruits and cereals. Would definitely go back to this hotel again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: pincho
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights, around Nov 20th 2006. Excellent location, very good installations. Breakfast good, and service was oustanding. Very friendly front desk. We would recommend this hotel to anyone planning to stay in Rome for a few days. Just loved it. Raul Poblete, Santiago, Chile rpc@mvc-sa.cl

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: xtos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on other trip advisor reviews, and the website photos of the decor, and the indoor pool and sauna. To our shock, the pool and sauna were both closed for maintenance during our stay. This greatly affected our enjoyment of the space, as we were really looking forward to the pool, and were willing to pay the extra money for this feature. Unfortunately the Hotel only offerred their apologies, but didn't offer anything else to make up for this inconvenience. It would have been a nice gesture to find some way to make up for it. Free airport shuttle service, a bottle of champagen, anything. Overall, the hotel was very nice and elegant. The room was spacious and elegant. We didn't have much of a view, but I'm guessing no one does, as we were on the top floor. Breakfast was also very good, as would be expected at these prices. They forgot to stock our mini-bar the second night, so we didn't have water in our room and were too tired to bother calling for room service. The location was good, but for the price I'll probably pick the Hotel Eden next time we visit. Overall, this hotel is just OK and would only be great if the price was cut in half.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Redbaytraveller
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a long weekend in Rome and decided to stay here after much looking on the web. Firstly its in a great location, just off a busy street with taxi's (and on hop-on-hop-off sightseeing bus route) and easy to find - opposite the US Embassy. It takes about 10mins to walk to the Spanish steps but the side streets were interesting and we passed both the Hotel Eden and the Intercontinental on the way - just confirmed how happy were were to be in the Rose Garden Palace. Secondly the ambience was cool! The 'new' interior is creams and cool beige, comfortable and relaxing. They have managed to keep the old character of the original building but give it a modern twist. The reception/bar area was great for a late night drink and a haven after a busy day sightseeing. Breakfast was ok, cold buffet with limited hot choice but was served until 11am. Happy hour was from 5pm-7pm with about 20% off drinks. We booked a de-luxe room for 385euro/night incl breakfast - and got a huge corner room on the forth floor with sitting area and dressing area - and complementray bottle of bubble. The staff were very helpful and knowledgeable and all spoke perfect English. Just one gripe - hotel charged us 65euro for airport pickup - local taxi fare is fixed at 45euro - ouch! We took a taxi back to the airport! Would stay again though and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “SEcond time here and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: CheeCheePepper
Reviews.Content: Went to Rose Garden Palace on my honeymoon. There was chamapaigne waiting. The location was in excellent shopping area, near many cafes and restaurants, the trevi fountain, and spanish steps. The room were clean, the shower pressure was the best presuure I have had in any shower. Closet space was huge. I read someone complaining earlier in the week about the street outside and by the time we got there the sidewalks were being put in and new roads. That is a city thing not the hotel and was finished by the end of our 3 night stay. (the whole street was paved in one night, imagine that in the states) Location was key. Only thing was only one TV station in English. The swimming pool was under renovation but it is very small, like a wading pool anyway. Fitness center is small yet has up to date equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing after all the amazing reviews”
Reviews.Author: welltravellednotts
Reviews.Content: We were expecting amazing things from this hotel as all the reviews were so positive but when we arrived all the footpaths outside were being replaced and so the inital picture that greeted us wasn't exactly great. Location wise its round the corner from the US Embassy, the Villa Borghese and Via Veneto so not hugely central. Our room was pretty uninspiring and dark with a really small bathroom, but it was clean. I get the feeling its more of a business travellers hotel than a tourist hotel. The pool was tiny and cold and the floor was very slippy and dangerous and the gym was also tiny. However, the staff on reception were polite and courteous and nothing was too much trouble. If you are looking for a comfortable hotel then this is fine, but its nothing remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Italy”
Reviews.Author: NicoleElaine
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! The staff was very accomadating to us and during our stay. They went out of their way to prepare a room for us when we arrived a 9 AM- after traveling for 20 hours and losing our luggage. The room was cozy and very clean. Beautiful view. Very close to a lot of restaurants & Via Veneto. Easy to walk to Spanish Steps & Trevi Fountain. Excellent breakfast with a lot of choices. Great coffee too! (Don't buy a drink at the bar though, it is at least $15 US) Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: light12
Reviews.Content: Situated a few meters from via veneto on the same street as hotel Eden, a very short walk from the Spanish steps The hotel is modern and comfortable , rooms are quite large and airy Breakfast is served on the first floor overlooking a small but charming garden , breakfast was a large buffet and the food was great. The hotel has a small swimming pool and gym , very usefull after a long shopping trip. Staff are super nice and friendly Would love to stay again next year

Reviews.Title: “Ask For Max!”
Reviews.Author: CoClare
Reviews.Content: The Rose Garden Palace lives up to reputation, and we would recommend it highly to anyone. It's decor is unusual, but we found it added to the "Roman" atmosphere. My wife, son, nephew, and I stayed in a mini-suite and it was large, spotless, cool and comfortable. The breakfast is fine for tourists on the go, and the pool is perfect for refreshing in the afternoons. The hotel is in a quiet area near the Via Veneto. We walked back from the Vatican one day, and passed through many of the "must see" sights of Rome. Many good restaurants within an easy walk, taxi stand is at end of block, and a church (St. Patrick's) with services in English is 1 block away. The economy is good, so there is construction everywhere, including the sidewalk outside the hotel. However, we heard no real noise and there is a pedestrian walk area. The staff were all helpful, but we need to single out one. Max at the desk was wonderful; from referring us to restaurants he knew (all excellent), to telling the boys what shops had the best deals on soccer jerseys, to being overall helpful with any questions, Max added to our holiday experience. We have stayed at top hotels in Europe and the States, and have never encountered someone this good. Rose Garden Palace management take notice please!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: allemange
Reviews.Content: We stayed here first week of June with 2 other couples. This hotel is in a wonderful location, (very secure near the American embassy) is clean, beds are comfy, nice size rooms for Rome. Typically smallish baths though very modern and clean, great breakfast and the staff very accomodating. The staff arranged taxi service for us 2 or 3 times and everything went as expected. My wife arranged a massage prior to our departure, they took her exactly on time and my wife said the massage was terrific. It really helped her overcome the jet lag. We travel to Europe frequently and this is the first time she tried massage to beat the jet lag. We did not experience any of the inconveniences described by others. The staff was super. They arranged dinner at Mirabelle prior to leaving and dinner at one of our other fav's: Il Tempio de Bacco. This is a nice place..I have been travelling to Rome for 40 years, believe me this is nice. It's not the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “It's a good one!!”
Reviews.Author: gccc44
Reviews.Content: This is a bit late, but we stayed there in november of 2004 and were very pleased with everything. While we don't usually use the pool at hotels, I won't comment on that, but the room was great..... overlooked the US Embassy.... and there were windows that opened with great big shutters.... nice. The tub was magnificent. I don't take tub baths, but this was so cool that I took a bath every night. Of course, having a fun tub partner probably helped, too. But it was definitely fun. The bed sheets were real linen and took a night to get used to, but then you realize that you are really in luxury then. It was a great room. Location was fine. We walked everywhere.... but bring a map and STUDY IT!!! You can get lost going to the corner in Rome! After a while my girlfriend and I started noticing how many people we saw that, (like us), had their heads buried in a map with confused looks on their faces. I've been there three times and I still get lost going to the bathroom. Back to the hotel.... the breakfast (I believe it was complimentary) was spectacular! Anything and everything you could possibly think of to eat at breakfast (and some things you wouldn't think of) were available. In fact, we ate hearty at breakfast and almost never ate again until dinner. This place was great. And, when I wanted tickets to a museum (can't remember the name, but it had several incredible Bernini sculptures...a MUST!!!), the front desk had them waiting in our room that evening for the next moring. Anyway, it was nice. Unless you are a really high class, 5-star traveler, I think you'll be more than happy with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here while visiting Rome and booked a suite, which turned out to be a jr suite that connects to another room for our two girls (ages 11 and 7). It was perfect. Amenities included a small pool. We ate breakfast there daily but did not eat other meals there so can't be more specific about food. The service was good once you get past the front desk. We both found that the front desk staff were aloof and standoffish. The location was reasonably convenient but you should count on plenty of walking. The Spanish steps were about a 15 minute walk (some of it uphill) and another 10 minutes or so to Trevi fountain or the Pantheon. We took three tours while in Rome, all with Angel tours; Vatican (go on a Tues or Thurs), Old Rome (leave this one with good restaurant recommendations from locals), and Colisseum/Forum. I very highly recommend them (ask for Jenny if possible). They are all native english speakers (all from Ireland).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Rude Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were fine. Quiet room, fine linens, extensive breakfast buffet. The location was excellent because its a block away from the Via Veneto, where all the food and shopping is located. It's close to the Spanish Steps and access to the subway, bus line, and train station. The hotel has great potential, if it weren't for the rather cold staff. We thought they were downright rude! Our feelings were confirmed when went to check out. The front desk attendent tried to charge us an exchange fee on our credit card transaction. When we asked him to remove the charge, he refused and claimed he didn't know how to do it. Hardly the service you should expect from a four star hotel!!!!!!! Needless to say, we won't stay there again, nor recommend it to anyone else.

HotelInfo.Name: Rose Garden Palace
HotelInfo.Address: Via Boncompagni 19, 00187 Rome, Italy
